title.narrative: INCLUSIVE EDUCATION

description.narrative: Children excluded from mainstream education, including those affected by humanitarian situations, exercise their right to an appropriate quality and inclusive education., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: An inclusive education system is equipped to provide comprehensive early childhood education to all children, in conjunction with health, nutrition and protection interventions, and to ensure the rights of all children to an appropriate quality education.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF BASIC AND SECONDARY EDUCATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children excluded from mainstream education, including those affected by humanitarian situations, exercise their right to anappropriate quality and inclusive education.

description.narrative: Significant progress was made in securing a population projection based on the 2013 census; which helped make;the education-data more rational.; Based on the new population projections;the school aged children (3– 8 years) population is projected at 1,017,591 children in 2021 with 328,365 (32%) out-of-school.;Out-of-School Children rate;for ECD(3-6 years) is 61%, Primary(7-12 years) is 15%, Lower Secondary(13-15 years) is 14% and Upper Secondary(16-18 years) is 41%. The under-age enrolment (< 3 years) is 1,761 children, while over-age (>18 years) is 32,860.; This gives a total school-enrolment of 723,848 children. Factors keeping;children out-of-school are either disability, geographical location, family income-level and social-norms.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/01/2022
